message.content:
Our approach is to try to “connect the dots” between Keith and Betty using the given relationships.

• Keith only appears in the relation “Keith is Andrew’s ancestor.” All other relationships linked to Keith (if any) would have come via Andrew and his descendants. However, scanning the list shows that Keith is part of one chain (for example, Keith → Andrew → Bryan → …) with no overlap with the names associated with Betty.

• Betty appears just once, in “Betty is Sophia's descendant.” From that relation we can trace upward: since Sophia is a descendant of Kelly (“Sophia is Kelly’s descendant”) and Kelly has an ancestor (Linda, because “Linda is Kelly’s ancestor”), Betty is on a separate line with the chain Billy → Linda → Kelly → Sophia → Betty (because we also have “Linda is Billy’s descendant”).

No statement links any person in Keith’s chain with any person in Betty’s chain, and there is no information suggesting that Keith is either Betty’s ancestor or descendant, or that there is some other link (like a common ancestor or common descendant) between them.

Thus, none of the provided choices (1, 2, 3, or 4) correctly describe the relationship between Keith and Betty.

<ANSWER>5</ANSWER>
